eshmun.structures.kripke

Class KripkeStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.structures.AbstractStructure
      • eshmun.structures.kripke.KripkeStructure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Repairable

    public class KripkeStructure
extends AbstractStructure
implements Repairable
    This class represents a Kripke Structure.

    All States and transitions in this structure are forced to be of type KripkeState, KripkeTransition respectively.

    The correct usage of this structure and its subclasses dictates the following:

    • Adding States: A state is created through one of its constructors, then added to the structure using the add method, parentStructure attribute is handled automatically.
    • Adding Transitions: A transition is created through one of its constructors then added to the structure using the add method, parenStructure attribute is handled automatically, also adding the transition to its states is handled automatically.
    • Removing States: A state should only be removed using its own remove() method, or through structure.remove(state). Both are guaranteed to respect the invariance.
    • Removing Transitions: A transition should only be removed using its own remove() method, or through structure.remove(transition). Both are guaranteed to respect the invariance, removing a transition from within a state will cause the invariance to break.

    Invariance:

    • A state is always mapped by its name, the state is immutable, thus this always hold.
    • A state always contains all it valid transitions, given that the transitions has been added through structure.add() method.
    • When a State is deleted, all its transitions are deleted with it.
    • All Start and retain states are always present in their respective lists, the same holds for retain transitions.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ali Cherri, Kinan Dak Al Bab

      • mapActionsToTransition

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<KripkeTransition>> mapActionsToTransition()
        Returns a mapping between actions and transitions that are named after them.

        For example: assuming the transition T1 has action name 'A1, A2, A3'. In the resulting map, all of "A1", "A2", and "A3" will be mapped to a list containing T1. If the transition T2 had action name A2, then "A2" will be mapped to a list containing both T1 and T2.

        Returns:
        A Map between actions and transitions.

      • mapLabelsToTransitions

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<KripkeTransition>> mapLabelsToTransitions()
        Returns a mapping between the change in labels and transitions.

        for example: (N1,K1=>C1 : [T1, T2, T3]) means that all of T1, T2, T3 change the labels N1 and K1 to C1.

        Returns:
        the required mapping.

      • modelCheck

        public boolean modelCheck(java.util.List<AbstractExpression> specifications)
        Model checks this structure against the specifications.

        If this is a single structure, the specifications are conjuncted into one big specification.

        If this contains multiple structures, the specifications are each mapped to an inner structure then model checked separately.

        The implementation details are determined in the sub-classes.

        Specified by:
        modelCheck in interface Repairable
        Parameters:
        specifications - the specifications of this structure.
        Returns:
        true if the structure abides by the specifications, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        AbstractExpression

      • stateByStateModelCheck

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> stateByStateModelCheck(AbstractExpression specifications)
        Model checks this structure state-by-state. Runs the model checker on each state (as if that state is the sole start state).
        Parameters:
        specifications - the formula to model check against.
        Returns:
        a list of var names of States that satisfy the formula (everything else does not).

      • generateRepairFormula

        public AndOperator generateRepairFormula(java.util.List<AbstractExpression> specifications,
                                         boolean actionSync,
                                         boolean processSync)
                                  throws NotCNFException,
                                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generates the repair formula for this structure against the specifications.

        If this is a single structure, the specifications are conjuncted into one big specification, then the repair formula is generated against it.

        If this contains multiple structures, the specifications are each mapped to an inner structure, each structure then generates its own repair formula separately then they are all conjuncted, this helps avoid Exponential blow-ups.

        The implementation details are determined in the sub-classes.

        Specified by:
        generateRepairFormula in interface Repairable
        Parameters:
        actionSync - ignored, useless.
        processSync - ignored, useless.
        specifications - the specifications of this structure.
        Returns:
        the repair formula of this structure against the specifications.
        Throws:
        NotCNFException - if some error occurred during conversion of specifications to cnf.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specifications contained labels not present in the structure.
        See Also:
        AbstractExpression, MultiKripkeStructure.actionSynchronizationFormula(), MultiKripkeStructure.processSynchronizationFormula()

      • setCNF

        public void setCNF(boolean cnf)
        Sets the CNF flag. determines if the repair formula must be generated in CNF format.
        Specified by:
        setCNF in interface Repairable
        Parameters:
        cnf - if true the repair formula will be generated in CNF (false if for debugging purposes).
